name: Optical Cable
overview: Optical Cable Corporation engages in the manufacture and sale of fiber optic cable and data communication connectivity solutions primarily for the enterprise market worldwide. The companyâ€™s fiber optic cables provide high bandwidth transmission of data, video, and voice communications over short- to moderate-distances. Its products comprise A-series assembly fiber optic cables for jumpers and pigtails; B-series breakout fiber optic cables for shorter distance installations; D-series distribution fiber optic cables optic cables for use in longer distance, buried, and overhead installations; G-series subgrouping fiber optic cables. The company also provides hybrid and composite cables for underground or overhead installations. In addition, it offers copper and fiber connectivity components consisting of copper closet and workstation connectivity solutions, including category compliant plugs and jacks, patch cords, faceplates, surface mounted boxes, distribution and multimedia boxes, patch panels, cable assemblies, cable organizers, connectors, and other wiring products for equipment room, telecommunications closet, datacenter, and workstation. Further, the company provides residential systems comprising various enclosures, modules, and modular outlets; and fiber optic connectivity products, such as splice trays, fiber optic jumpers, plug and play cassette modules, adapters, and accessories. Additionally, it provides network, data storage, and telecommunications management systems consisting of data cabinets, horizontal and vertical cable management systems, and open frame relay racks. Its customers include distributors, original equipment manufacturers, value-added resellers, and end-users. The company provides its products for commercial, enterprise network, and campus installations, as well as specialty, residential, military, industrial, mining, and broadcast applications.

acquisitions.source_description: Optical Cable Corporation Acquires Applied Optical Systems, Inc.
